intro: Ophiorrhiza nicobarica, commonly known as the Nicobar sandalwood, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rhizophoraceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pink in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. Ophiorrhiza nicobarica is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand saline conditions, making it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
